Graduate College     Search the site     Toggle Menu      Search                  Graduate College      Graduate College   Main Menu    Admissions           Degree Admissions    Application Deadlines         Funding & Awards           Graduate Funding Overview    Fellowships & Awards    Other Funding         Programs           Graduate College Courses    Graduate Program in Neuroscience         Diversity           Recruitment    Fellows Mentoring & Support    DFI Program    PIF Program    PBRC-PREP Program    SROP Undergraduate Program         Academics           Dates & Events    Registration Info    Thesis    Exams & Defense    Policies & Procedures    TA Enrichment    Graduation Info    Student Forms    Student Resources         About Us           Staff Directory    Faculty Listings    Newsletters    Contact Us          Eyebrow menu    Faculty & Staff Resources    Alumni    +Give    UIC menu    UIC.edu    Campus Map       Search               View Menu           Breadcrumbs   Graduate College    Admissions    Degree Admission        Degree Admission       Application Procedure   Application Procedure & Deadlines  Applicants to graduate study at UIC must use the online application form. Applications and supporting credentials should be submitted as early as possible, but no later than the published deadlines for the program to which you are applying. Applications received after the deadline will not be accepted.  Some graduate programs have application deadlines that are earlier than the University deadline, and some admit students only in specific terms (e.g. fall term only). Prospective applicants should contact the program of interest for information on current deadlines, as some programs may close earlier than the published deadlines.  Please note the following:   You must upload transcripts. Unofficial transcripts will be used to evaluate admission eligibility. If you are admitted, official transcripts will be requested at that time, along with submission instructions.  If your program requires letters of recommendation, you will need to provide email addresses for your recommenders.  Program-specific requirements (e.g. writing samples, personal statements, resumes, letters of purpose, letters of recommendation, etc.) must be submitted within the application, unless specifically directed to you otherwise by the program to which you are applying. (GRE, TOEFL, IELTS and other test scores must be sent directly from the testing service to UIC. UICâ€™s Institutional Code is 1851 for the GRE and the TOEFL).   Admission recommendations cannot be made until all required documents have been received.    Online Application Form    Office of Admissions    Application Deadlines    Graduate Applicants FAQs         Programs Outside of Graduate College   Programs Outside of Graduate College  Applicants to professional and graduate degree programs that are not part of the Graduate College should follow the admission procedures of those units. These include:    Liautaud Graduate School of Business (Accounting [MS], Business Administration [PhD], Finance [MS], and Management Information Systems [MS, PhD])    Doctor of Nursing Practice [DNP]    Engineering [MEng]    Doctor of Occupational Therapy [OTD]    Social Work [MSW]    School of Public Health [MS, MHA, PhD]            Admissions           Degree Admissions     Domestic Admission    International Admission      Application Deadlines
